main event: One object white in color, appearing as bright as the full moon, was observed heading from 22 degrees to 240 degrees before the light went out.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 1 minute and 30 seconds with the duration of observation being 60 seconds., The object was reported to be 5 times as bright as a full moon., The observers described the light as parabolic-like before it extinguished., The sighting took place at 1925 on 19 April 1957., The report speculated that the object could have been a balloon or aircraft.
